content.description: Sit start with your hands matched on the obvious chalked up flake to the left under the roof. A heel hook and some toe cams with get you along the flake to a crimp and a sloper. Pull straight up to jug, mantle over your sloper to another jug to your left and top out.
content.protection: Great landing, watch out for the small tree.
content.location: The boulder with a small roof to the right of the boulder with Bone Crusher. Also refer to the PABouldering app. This is on the yogi boulder at the South side set and it starts the same as C1 which is still undone..

content.description: Start under the roof with some good hands on a horizontal and reach back for a side pull crimp on the flake. Some foot work and a good reach will get you out to the triangular jug at the end of the flake that is now flexing as you hang on it. Reach out to the roof throw up a heel and do some pull ups to top out.
content.protection: These roofs have great landing areas.
content.location: Once you find the Southside Boulders keep walk back until you see the one with the biggest overhang.

content.description: This area is home to some sweet boulder problems, hosting some slab climbs and some challenges roofs. Right now in the guide there are about 8 climbs listed but there are more going up and there is a ton of room for development. PLEASE NOTE. Ticks in this area specifically the Southside set are crazy bad, check yourselves quite a bit after hiking to and from the area.
